articles.title: Matt Barker
articles.contents:
Matt Barker
          
          
          Hello
          Publications
          Teaching
          
          
          
          â˜°
          
          
      
        
          
            Matt Barker
          
          
            
              I am a forester/UAS remote pilot/remote sensing scientist living in Corvallis, OR. I study as a PhD student at Oregon State University and receive funding as a graduate teaching/reasearch assistant. I am an associate of the Aerial Information Systems lab directed by my advisor, Michael Wing. Additionally, I am an ORISE research participant, collaborating with the USFS PNW research facility. Current passions include: trees, drones, GIS, statistics, coding, and surfing.

articles.title: Untitled
articles.description: A new article created using the Distill format.
articles.contents:
Distill is a publication format for scientific and technical writing, native to the web.
Learn more about using Distill for R Markdown at https://rstudio.github.io/distill.
